20 hours ago, paul23 said:

That requires active action from a customer. So the default *is* to expect and get updates: and we as customer can reasonably expect reasonable bug free software. And fixing of bugs in a reasonable amount of time.

"we as customer can reasonably expect reasonable bug free software" - You can with KSP2, which is coded by a major developer. KSP was developed by a small independent studio that never had a game release before. It struggles with 7+ years of legacy codebase. It was on Steam Early Access prior to the 1.0 launch. Do you know of any Steam Early Access project that was reasonably bug-free? Personally, I've seen very few. We as customers can reasonably expect to have, at some point, a stable product without major bugs. (which was fulfilled in 1.3.1) We can furthermore expect that any future release which adds functionality will introduce new bugs. We can also reasonably expect that 1.8.x might be the final release of the game. (but it might not)

Squad has no obligation to release any more updates to the game - we all paid for the finished version as-is, and the game has been around long enough and generated enough commentary in this forum and on Steam that no one can reasonably claim the existing issues and legacy problems weren't advertised or known. No one is going in blind unless they choose to. We can hope for a bug-free release, but we can't expect it, and they're not obligated to provide it. As a small shop, they really can't afford to pay a large QA team. And given the complexity of the game, and its moddability, there's no way they can predict all of the ways someone is using the game and guard against all possible bugs.

That said, I'd like to see them resurrect their limited release betas that they had prior to the Take Two acquisition.
